shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 2ra – 55rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 60 titles (fols. 2ra-3ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 3ra-rb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 4ra-55rb) II) Gospel of Mark (fols. 55va-86va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 44 titles (fol. 55va-vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 56ra-86va) - Short postscript to the Gospel of Mark (fol. 86va) III) Gospel of Luke (fols. 86vb-137vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 93 titles (fols. 86vb-87va) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 88ra-137vb) - Short postscript to the Gospel of Luke (fol. 137vb) IV) Gospel of John (fols. 138ra-179vb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 138ra-179vb) - Short postscript to the Gospel of John (fol. 179vb) - General postscript to the Four Gospels (fol. 179vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Late 16th - early 17th century (?). Quire A originates from a different, more recent manuscript (18th cent.?), inserted sideways as protective leaf.

txstates.txstate: The threads of the binding are broken, some quires are loose. The back board is broken, the leather cover and textile inlays are to the most part torn off. Some leaves (e.g., containing traditional introduction to the Gospels) are probably lost. The Ms. has been resewn; pricks of the original sewing are visible on the spine. Part of Text IV – the list of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John – has been misplaced into Text I (Gospel of Matthew). Traces and turn-ins of a previous overback are preserved on the inner side of both boards.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather, textile inlays (the back board is broken; leather and textile inlays are to the most part torn off).

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 1 tool was used: double line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Some quires are reinforced by parchment guards (quires I, II, III, VI, etc.).

squires.squire:
{A(1/fol. 1)} – I(1/fol. 2) – II(1/fol. 3) – III(8/fols. 4r-11v) – IV(8/fols. 12r-19v) – V(8/fols. 20r-27v) – VI(8/fols. 28r-35v) – VII(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VIII(8/fols. 44r-51v) – IX(4/fols. 52r-55v) – X(8/fols. 56r-63v) – XI(9; s. l.: 1, 3, 4, stubs after 8 (2), 9/fols. 64r-72v) – XII(8/fols. 73r-80v) – XIII(7; s. l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 81r-87v) – XIV(8/fols. 88r-95v) – XV(8; s. l.: 3, 6, stubs after 2, 5/fols. 96r-103v) – XVI(8/fols. 104r-111v) – XVII(8/fols. 112r-119v) – XVIII(8/fols. 120r-127v) – XIX(2/fols. 128r-129v) - XX(8; s. l.: 7, stub after 1/fols. 129r-137v) – XXI(8/fols. 138r-145v) – XXII(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XXIII(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXIV(8/fols. 162r-169v) – XXV(8/fols. 170r-177v) – XXVI(2/fols. 178r-179v)
Quires A, I and II consist of single leaves only (fol. 3 is misplaced here from its proper position between fols. 137 and 138), to which parchment strips were attached. The only leaf of quire A is inserted sideways.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling is partly visible; pricking is visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 29r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 20r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; incipits and headings of the texts; postscripts to the Gospels of Mark, Luke and John; marginal notes repeating chapter titles or indicating Gospel readings for certain occasions; chi rho and crux ansata signs; elements of the punctuation signs; chapter numbers and the word mǝˤǝraf.
Incipits of the Gospel texts are written alternately in red and black lines (fols. 4r, 56r, 88r, 138r).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Chi rho sing (s. fols. 12r, 31r, 104r, etc.).
The Golden Gospel of ʾAgamyo Qǝddus Mikaʾel church.

extras.extra: - Fols. 6v, 56r, 137v (in the upper margin): Crude notes. - Fol. 1 (quire I) is a leaf from a different, more recent manuscript (18th cent.?) with a non-identified text (theological treatise?) written in three columns.

frames.frame: Fol. 4r: Large, elaborate ornamental band; interlaces in red, with one central pendant (reaching l.11) and two lateral pendants (reaching l.10).
